title: Fixed setup.py to handle CUDNN_LIBRARY envvar with aten
body_html:
I ran into an issue building from source. When I ran python setup.py install things seemed to build ok, but at runtime it said that the cudnn that I build with was different than the one I was linking against. Sure enough I thought I was building with 7, but I was linking against 6.

It turns out the issue was that aten looks at the CUDNN_LIBRARY variable, but this was not being set in setup.py. Only the CUDNN_LIB_DIR was handled.

This change modifies tools/setup_helpers/cudnn.py to look for the CUDNN_LIBRARY variable and checks to make sure it agrees with CUDNN_LIB_DIR. I then appropriately pass down the variable to aten in torch/lib/build_libs.sh.

Finally during my debugging I added an if __name__ == '__main__' to setup.py to avoid calling setup when I imported the file to debug its variables. It seems like it should be there so I left it in.

body:
I ran into an issue building from source. When I ran `python setup.py install` things seemed to build ok, but at runtime it said that the cudnn that I build with was different than the one I was linking against. Sure enough I thought I was building with 7, but I was linking against 6. 

It turns out the issue was that `aten` looks at the `CUDNN_LIBRARY` variable, but this was not being set in `setup.py`. Only the `CUDNN_LIB_DIR` was handled. 

This change modifies `tools/setup_helpers/cudnn.py` to look for the `CUDNN_LIBRARY` variable and checks to make sure it agrees with `CUDNN_LIB_DIR`. I then appropriately pass down the variable to `aten` in `torch/lib/build_libs.sh`. 

Finally during my debugging I added an `if __name__ == '__main__'` to setup.py to avoid calling setup when I imported the file to debug its variables. It seems like it should be there so I left it in.
